website_summaries.verdict: The KEEN Glenhaven Mid exhibits a nondescript silhouette that works best with semi-formal attire. It separates itself from other KEEN high-top sneakers with its bungee enclosure. Despite having a rigid-looking construction, many users attested to its lightweight properties. While there are lots of positive attributes going on with the Glenhaven Mid shoes, wearers have to recognize that it may not give an easy on and off wear.
pros: For a couple of regular KEEN purchasers, they lauded the Glenhaven Mid’s well-made construction and high-quality materials
A considerable number of KEEN Glenhaven Mid reviews advised that no break-in is required to obtain the best possible fit
The design of the mid-top allows it to be used for special semi-formal occasions, as per a couple of wearers
A few of the users said that this footwear feels light
Some purchasers praised the insole for being removable as it can accommodate custom orthotics
Many customers implied that the Glenhaven Mid is durable
There are a number of buyers who stated that the toe box has ample wiggle room
A shopper is delighted that the package has a pair of regular laces
cons: Several customers warned that it is slightly a challenge to put on and off the high-top
A retailer website advised that this sneaker runs small
If compared to other KEEN sneakers, the Glenhaven Mid feels narrow, especially in the middle area

customer_reviews.title: Love the style/ material, and craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the style of these. Good leather material along with attention to detail in construction of these shoes. Only thing I have to comment on is the size runs a bit larger as they got broken in. I’m usually a solid 9.5 in this style of shoe, but these are a little larger by almost half a size. I could probably do an insole or thicker socks, but I’d buy these again if I ever wear them out.
customer_reviews.author: WallyMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair thinking this would be a wide , comfortable shoe, but for it was not. I have wide feet and have a few Keen shoes that work well for me. Being a lover of Chuck Taylor type shoes I also thought this would be a comparable shoe in many ways, it is not. The sole is incredibly thin and the overall feel is too tight for my sizing. I had to return these. I think Keen failed to deliver on this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: <Anvil.Chorus>

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe but VERY uncomfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Was so disappointed when the shoes arrived! I absolutely love the style and the look however after trying it on and wearing them around the house for a couple of days the leather upper on the shoe is so stiff and uncomfortable that I could no longer wear them. Unfortunately I don’t think that the leather will ever soften to a point that they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Breeggemann

customer_reviews.title: Strutting in style!
customer_reviews.text: Keens are awesome shoes, comfortable, we'll made, durable, and long lasting. I cannot recommend these enough. I have been wearing Keen oxfords for years to work in the yard, and around the house, but my husband had never worn them. I bought hubby these for his bday, and he loves them, stylish, and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: The laces suck. Everything else is good.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits well. It is made to be sturdy and durable. The one problem is that the laces are too short so I can't double knot. I can barely single knot. The material of the laces are very stiff and slip out of the knot very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved this shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great leather "sneaker". The fit is great just like all Keen shoes, it broke in the first time wearing it. I like the clean lines and style. Very happy with this shoe!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: Fun and hip sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. The color scheme is awesome too. I couldn't be happier with my hip new Keen sneakers
customer_reviews.author: C. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I just got them but I love these shoes already. I normally wear size 11.5 with my Merrell hiking shoes. I read a review saying these Keens run about a half size large so I ordered size 11 and they fit perfectly. Cool style, comfortable and lightweight with heavy duty laces. Quite a score at 67 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, tough and rugged and even somewhat water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Shoe has held up well. Not much arch support so need to wear insert with them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow!
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and the steel/magnet color ... BUT they're not as comfortable as the old KEEN shoes were. If you're used to the KEEN shoes with the wide toe box and the rubber bumper on the front (like I am) then you'll find these to be significantly narrower. I went up half a size and still found them to be too narrow. Disappointing. (same problem with the Winterhaven -- I went up a full size and still had to use a shoe stretcher to get them wide enough to be comfortable.) They must have hired a new designer who doesn't understand why KEEN shoes (and sandals) were so popular. These just don't feel like a KEEN product.
customer_reviews.author: mdiddy

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous Keens!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with my latest pair of Keens, previous pairs have fitted like a glove and been really comfortable from day one. This latest pair are in my view not of the same quality, the leather of the uppers is extremely hard and unforgiving making them difficult to put on and initially uncomfortable to wear. Hopefully they will soften up the more they are worn, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Firebox50
